page.title: 02HARDLEY SCHOOL
page.content: Hardly comprehensive school is the only secondary school in this particular block. The headmaster is Mr. Underwood and the school is situated on Long Lane, Holbury. It was opened in 1935, so this is its 50th anniversary, and it has grown in size to meet the demands of the area as it has expanded. It takes in children between the age of 12 and 16. The school has between 700 and 800 in a year. Mr. Underwood calculates that in 1991 there will be a minimum number of students due to trends in the birth rate and this will be in the region of 740. The backgrounds of the pupils fall into two different categorties one, families who have lived in the area for generations or two, the families who travel.
